summary: The text discusses the symbolic meaning of 'winter' as a time of tribulation or end of mortal life. It references a command from the Lord in the Gospel, advising disciples to pray that their flight does not occur in winter or on the Sabbath. If this relates to the captivity of Jerusalem by Titus and Vespasian, the prayer is to avoid fleeing during winter due to harsh conditions or on the Sabbath due to the transgression of law, both carrying risks of death. If it pertains to the end of the world, it advises maintaining faith and love in Christ without becoming idle in God's work.
